'''Notes'''
Apart from few manor details this laptop is working well under Ubuntu 12.04. Things that are failing: 
1) suspend is not very reliable and around every 15th resume fails
2) currently as of 9-Oct-2012 Ubuntu 12.10 Beta 2 doesn't work on this laptop. I have raised ticket for it - https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xorg/+bug/1064626

This laptop is from the HP series which suffer from overheating. Currently when using just gedit, GPU reports 66 degree Celcius. 
Nvidia graphic works fine with open source drivers, so I have no borthered to install proprietary driver. VGI and HDMI output work fine, however there is no sound on HDMI with nouveau driver. So if you want to use your TV speakers, then you have to install proprietary drivers.
This is my third Pavilion laptop I am testing, but again slightly different model. This one is about 15" size and came with remote control and blue ray recorder as a standard. 
I am happy to report that SD card reader works perfectly fine (in contrast to previous HP Pavilion laptops I have tested)
